briefTitle: Effectiveness of Multicomponent Lipid Emulsion in Preterm Infants Requiring Parenteral Nutrition

armGroups.label: control group
interventionNames: Drug: pure soybean oil lipid emulsion

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Inborn infants with a gestational age of less than 30 weeks
* Who required parenteral nutrition for at least 7 days

Exclusion Criteria:

* Evidence of congenital infection
* Perinatal asphyxia
* Congenital anomalies
* Severe IVH
* Thrombocytopenia
* Shock or circulation failure
* Renal or hepatic disorders.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Neonatal Cholestasis
outcomeMeasures.description: direct bilirubin level of more than 2 mg/dL

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Extrauterine Growth Restriction (EUGR)
outcomeMeasures.description: weight that is less than the tenth percentile for corrected gestational age by the time of discharge

outcomeMeasures.title: Weight Gain
outcomeMeasures.description: in-hospital weight gain at birth until discharge (gram/day)

outcomeMeasures.title: Height Gain
outcomeMeasures.description: in-hospital height gain at birth until discharge (cm/week)

outcomeMeasures.title: Head Circumference Gain
outcomeMeasures.description: in-hospital head circumference gain at birth until discharge (cm/week)

outcomeMeasures.title: Assessment of Gamma Glutamyltranspeptidase (GGT)
outcomeMeasures.description: blood samples were obtained before enrollment, week 1, 2 and 3 (U/L) after parenteral nutrition administration

outcomeMeasures.title: Assessment of Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT)
outcomeMeasures.description: blood samples were obtained before enrollment, week 1, 2 and 3 (U/L) after parenteral nutrition administration

outcomeMeasures.title: Assessment of Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST)
outcomeMeasures.description: blood samples were obtained before enrollment, week 1, 2 and 3 (U/L) after parenteral nutrition administration
